items.creator: Unit 42
items.title: Threat Brief: CVE-2024-6387 OpenSSH RegreSSHion Vulnerability
items.dc:creator: Unit 42
items.content:
This threat brief details CVE-2024-6387, called RegreSSHion, an RCE vulnerability affecting connectivity tool OpenSSH servers on glibc-based Linux systems.

The post Threat Brief: CVE-2024-6387 OpenSSH RegreSSHion Vulnerability appeared first on Unit 42.

items.dc:creator: Brody Kutt

items.creator: Jay Chen
items.title: Attack Paths Into VMs in the Cloud
items.dc:creator: Jay Chen
items.content:
Virtual machines (VMs) are a significant attack target. Focusing on three major CSPs, this research summarizes the conditions for possible VM attack paths.

The post Attack Paths Into VMs in the Cloud appeared first on Unit 42.

items.creator: Lior Rochberger and Daniel Frank
items.title: Operation Diplomatic Specter: An Active Chinese Cyberespionage Campaign Leverages Rare Tool Set to Target Governmental Entities in the Middle East, Africa and Asia
items.dc:creator: Lior Rochberger and Daniel Frank
items.content:
A Chinese APT group is targeting political entities across multiple continents. Named Operation Diplomatic Specter, this campaign uses rare techniques and a unique toolset.

The post Operation Diplomatic Specter: An Active Chinese Cyberespionage Campaign Leverages Rare Tool Set to Target Governmental Entities in the Middle East, Africa and Asia appeared first on Unit 42.

items.creator: Ashkan Hosseini and Ashutosh Chitwadgi
items.title: Payload Trends in Malicious OneNote Samples
items.dc:creator: Ashkan Hosseini and Ashutosh Chitwadgi
items.content:

items.creator: Shu Wang, Ruian Duan and Daiping Liu
items.title: Leveraging DNS Tunneling for Tracking and Scanning
items.dc:creator: Shu Wang, Ruian Duan and Daiping Liu

items.creator: Unit 42
items.title: Threat Brief: Operation MidnightEclipse, Post-Exploitation Activity Related to CVE-2024-3400 (Updated May 20)

items.creator: Margaret Zimmermann
items.title: Muddled Libra’s Evolution to the Cloud
items.dc:creator: Margaret Zimmermann
items.content:
Muddled Libra now actively targets CSP environments and SaaS applications. Using the MITRE ATT&CK framework, we outline observed TTPs from incident response.

items.title: It Was Not Me! Malware-Initiated Vulnerability Scanning Is on the Rise
items.dc:creator: Beliz Kaleli, Fang Liu, Peng Peng, Alex Starov, Joey Allen and Stefan Springer

items.creator: Benjamin Chang, Goutam Tripathy, Pranay Kumar Chhaparwal, Anmol Maurya and Vishwa Thothathri
items.title: Large-Scale StrelaStealer Campaign in Early 2024
items.dc:creator: Benjamin Chang, Goutam Tripathy, Pranay Kumar Chhaparwal, Anmol Maurya and Vishwa Thothathri
items.content:
We unravel the details of two large-scale StrelaStealer campaigns from 2023 and 2024. This email credential stealer has a new variant delivered through zipped JScript.

The post Large-Scale StrelaStealer Campaign in Early 2024 appeared first on Unit 42.

items.creator: Tom Fakterman, Daniel Frank and Jerome Tujague
items.title: Curious Serpens’ FalseFont Backdoor: Technical Analysis, Detection and Prevention
items.dc:creator: Tom Fakterman, Daniel Frank and Jerome Tujague
items.content:
Iran-linked APT Curious Serpens is using a new backdoor, FalseFont, to target the aerospace and defense industries through fake job recruitment.
